title: Trump's doctor claims President takes drug for hair growth
text:
Trump's doctor reportedly claims President takes drug for hair growth Trump's doctor claims President takes drug for hair growth Updated:  32 PM 
The mystery of President Trump's quiff is once again in the crosshairs. 
Trump allegedly takes a prostate-related drug to stimulate hair growth, the new commander in chief's longtime doctor recently revealed to the New York Times . 
Dr. Harold Bornstein, who has a private practice on the Upper East Side, told the newspaper that Trump takes a small dose of the drug finasteride, which lowers prostate specific antigen. Its manufacturer, Propecia, markets the drug as a treatment for male baldness. 
Bornstein said he also takes the drug, noting it has allowed him to keep his own mane of shoulder-length hair and Trump to maintain his charachteristic blonde hairdo. "He has all his hair," Bornstein said of Trump. "I have all my hair." (Evan Vucci/AP) 
"He has all his hair," Bornstein said. "I have all my hair." 
The White House did not immediately return a request for comment. Tags:
